page.title: 18CROSS-SECTION OF AIRE VALLEY
page.content: WE DECIDED TO DO A CROSS-SECTION ALONG THE DIAGONAL OF THE BLOCK FROM THE S.W TO THE N.EAS THIS SHOWS A GREAT CONTRAST IN THE BLOCK. STARTING IN THE S.W OF THE BLOCK IN BRAMLEY PARK AT 150M ABOVE SEA LEVEL WE DROP DOWN THE VALLEYSIDE THROUGH BUILT HOUSES AROUND THE PARK. AFTER APPROXIMATELY 750M WE PASS THE MODERNISED MILL KNOWN AS ST.CATHERINE'S,CONVERTED IN A SCHEME TO HELP THE UNEMPLOYED,AND MOVE INTO THE COUNCIL ESTATE OF SANDFORD.THIS IS A DENSELY POPULATED ESTATE WITH HIGH UNEMPLOYMENT.ONCE OUT OF THEESTATE THE LAND FALLS AWAY QUICKLY TO THE CANAL. WITHIN THE NEXT 500M AT A HEIGHT OF BETWEEN 45 AND 50MTS ABOVE SEA LEVEL CAN BE SEEN MAJOR ROUTEWAYS AND COMMUNICATION NETWORKS,THE LEEDS LIVERPOOL CANAL,THE MAJOR TRANS-PENNINE RAILWAY,(MORE NEXT PAGE)
